content: What is the name of the 19th-century American author known for his adventure novels, including "The Adventures of Tom Sawyer" and "Adventures of Huckleberry Finn"?

The author you're referring to is Mark Twain. He was a prominent American writer, humorist, and lecturer in the 19th century. His real name was Samuel Langhorne Clemens, and he used "Mark Twain" as his pen name. Twain's works are celebrated for their wit, satire, and deep insights into human nature, particularly through the lens of his characters Tom Sawyer and Huckleberry Finn, who have become iconic figures in American literature.
